summary: Use this api to search orders
description: Use this api to search orders. You may also filter them by status, if needed.

query.name: order_sn_list
query.description: The set of order_sn. If there are multiple order_sn, you need to use English comma to connect them. limit [1,50]

query.name: request_order_status_pending
query.description: Compatible parameter during migration period, send True will let API support PENDING status and return pending_terms, send False or don‚Äôt send will fallback to old logic

query.name: response_optional_fields
query.description: a response fields you want to get. Please select from the below response parameters. If you input an object field, all the params under it will be included automatically in the response. If there are multiple response fields you want to get, you need to use English comma to connect them. Available values: buyer_user_id,buyer_username,estimated_shipping_fee,recipient_address,actual_shipping_fee ,goods_to_declare,note,note_update_time,item_list,pay_time,dropshipper, dropshipper_phone,split_up,buyer_cancel_reason,cancel_by,cancel_reason,actual_shipping_fee_confirmed,buyer_cpf_id,fulfillment_flag,pickup_done_time,package_list,shipping_carrier,payment_method,total_amount,buyer_username,invoice_data,order_chargeable_weight_gram,return_request_due_date,edt

request_examples.code:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, array(
  CURLOPT_URL => 'https://open.admin.shopee.io/api/v2/order/get_order_detail?access_token=access_token&order_sn_list=201214JAJXU6G7%2C201214JASXYXY6&partner_id=partner_id&request_order_status_pending=true&response_optional_fields=total_amount&shop_id=shop_id&sign=sign&timestamp=timestamp',
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 0,
  CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'GET',
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array(
    'Content-Type: application/json'
  ),
));

$response = curl_exec($curl);

curl_close($curl);
echo $response;

schema.name: request_id
schema.description: The identifier for an API request for error tracking.

schema.name: error
schema.description: Indicate error type if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

schema.name: message
schema.description: Indicate error details if hit error. Empty if no error happened.

schema.name: response
schema.description: Detail informations you are querying.

schema.name: order_list
schema.description: The list of orders.

schema.name: order_sn
schema.description: Return by default. Shopee's unique identifier for an order.

schema.name: region
schema.description: Return by default. The two-digit code representing the region where the order was made.

schema.name: currency
schema.description: Return by default. The three-digit code representing the currency unit for which the order was paid.

schema.name: cod
schema.description: Return by default. This value indicates whether the order was a COD (cash on delivery) order.

schema.name: total_amount
schema.description: The total amount paid by the buyer for the order. This amount includes the total sale price of items, shipping cost beared by buyer; and offset by Shopee promotions if applicable. This value will only return after the buyer has completed payment for the order.

schema.name: pending_terms
schema.description: The list of pending terms, possible values: SYSTEM_PENDING for order under Shopee internal processing, KYC_PENDING for order under KYC checking(TW CB order only)

schema.name: order_status
schema.description: Return by default. Enumerated type that defines the current status of the order.

schema.name: shipping_carrier
schema.description: The logistics service provider that the buyer selected for the order to deliver items.

schema.name: payment_method
schema.description: The payment method that the buyer selected to pay for the order. Applicable values: See Data Definition- Payment Methods.

schema.name: estimated_shipping_fee
schema.description: The estimated shipping fee is an estimation calculated by Shopee based on specific logistics courier's standard.

schema.name: message_to_seller
schema.description: Return by default. Message to seller.

schema.name: create_time
schema.description: Return by default. Timestamp that indicates the date and time that the order was created.

schema.name: update_time
schema.description: Return by default. Timestamp that indicates the last time that there was a change in value of order, such as order status changed from 'Paid' to 'Completed'.

schema.name: days_to_ship
schema.description: Return by default. Shipping preparation time set by the seller when listing item on Shopee.

schema.name: ship_by_date
schema.description: Return by default. The deadline to ship out the parcel.

schema.name: buyer_user_id
schema.description: The user id of buyer of this order, will be empty if it is a non-integrated order in TW region.

schema.name: buyer_username
schema.description: The name of buyer, will be masked as "****" if it is a non-integrated order in TW region.

schema.name: recipient_address
schema.description: This object contains detailed breakdown for the recipient address. Different parameters might be masked according to each market and kind of seller. For TW region integrated channel orders will be all masked as "****". More details may refer the announcement.

schema.name: name
schema.description: Recipient's name for the address.

schema.name: phone
schema.description: Recipient's phone number input when order was placed. [Only for TW non-integrated channel] Will return "****" when the "virtual_contact_number" is available

schema.name: town
schema.description: The town of the recipient's address. Whether there is a town will depend on the region and/or country.

schema.name: district
schema.description: The district of the recipient's address. Whether there is a district will depend on the region and/or country.

schema.name: city
schema.description: The city of the recipient's address. Whether there is a city will depend on the region and/or country.

schema.name: state
schema.description: The state/province of the recipient's address. Whether there is a state/province will depend on the region and/or country.

schema.name: region
schema.description: The two-digit code representing the region of the Recipient.

schema.name: zipcode
schema.description: Recipient's postal code.

schema.name: full_address
schema.sample: C-15-14 BLOK C JALAN 30/146, Asajaya, 40009, Sarawak
schema.description: The full address of the recipient, including country, state, even street, and etc.

schema.name: actual_shipping_fee
schema.description: The actual shipping fee of the order if available from external logistics partners.

schema.name: goods_to_declare
schema.description: Only work for cross-border order.This value indicates whether the order contains goods that are required to declare at customs. "T" means true and it will mark as "T" on the shipping label; "F" means false and it will mark as "P" on the shipping label. This value is accurate ONLY AFTER the order trackingNo is generated, please capture this value AFTER your retrieve the trackingNo.

schema.name: note
schema.description: The note seller made for own reference.

schema.name: note_update_time
schema.description: Update time for the note.

schema.name: item_list
schema.description: This object contains the detailed breakdown for the result of this API call.

schema.name: item_id
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for an item.

schema.name: item_name
schema.description: The name of the item.

schema.name: item_sku
schema.description: A item SKU (stock keeping unit) is an identifier defined by a seller, sometimes called parent SKU. Item SKU can be assigned to an item in Shopee Listings.

schema.name: model_id
schema.description: ID of the model that belongs to the same item.

schema.name: model_name
schema.description: Name of the model that belongs to the same item. A seller can offer models of the same item. For example, the seller could create a fixed-priced listing for a t-shirt design and offer the shirt in different colors and sizes. In this case, each color and size combination is a separate model. Each model can have a different quantity and price.

schema.name: model_sku
schema.description: A model SKU (stock keeping unit) is an identifier defined by a seller. It is only intended for the seller's use. Many sellers assign a SKU to an item of a specific type, size, and color, which are models of one item in Shopee Listings.

schema.name: model_quantity_purchased
schema.description: The number of identical items purchased at the same time by the same buyer from one listing/item.

schema.name: model_original_price
schema.description: The original price of the item in the listing currency.

schema.name: model_discounted_price
schema.description: The after-discount price of the item in the listing currency. If there is no discount, this value will be same as that of model_original_price. In case of bundle deal item, this value will return 0 as by design bundle deal discount will not be breakdown to item/model level. Due to technical restriction, the value will return the price before bundle deal if we don't configure it to 0. Please call GetEscrowDetails if you want to calculate item-level discounted price for bundle deal item.

schema.name: wholesale
schema.description: This value indicates whether buyer buy the order item in wholesale price.

schema.name: weight
schema.description: The weight of the item

schema.name: add_on_deal
schema.description: To indicate if this item belongs to an addon deal.

schema.name: main_item
schema.description: To indicate if this item is main item or sub item. True means main item, false means sub item.

schema.name: add_on_deal_id
schema.description: A unique ID to distinguish groups of items in Cart, and Order. (e.g. AddOnDeal)

schema.name: promotion_type
schema.description: Available typeÔºöproduct_promotion, flash_sale, bundle_deal, add_on_deal_main, add_on_deal_sub. For items which attend multiple promotions will only show one promotion, the order of priority is: bundle_deal > add_on_deal_main > add_on_deal_sub > product_promotion >flash_sale

schema.name: promotion_id
schema.description: The ID of the promotion.

schema.name: order_item_id
schema.description: The identify of order item.

schema.name: promotion_group_id
schema.description: The identify of product promotion.

schema.name: image_info
schema.description: Image info of the product.

schema.name: image_url
schema.description: The image url of the product. Default to be variation image, if the model does not have a variation image, will use an item main image instead.

schema.name: product_location_id
schema.description: The fulfilment warehouse ID(s) of the items in the order. (Multi-Warehouse sellers only)

schema.name: is_prescription_item
schema.description: To indicate if this item is prescription item

schema.name: is_b2c_owned_item
schema.description: determine if item is B2C_shop_item It should be `is_b2c_shop_item` but it was a bug from dev. Then now it's is_b2c_owned_item

schema.name: pay_time
schema.description: The time when the order status is updated from UNPAID to PAID. This value is NULL when order is not paid yet.

schema.name: dropshipper
schema.description: For Indonesia orders only. The name of the dropshipper.

schema.name: dropshipper_phone
schema.description: The phone number of dropshipper, could be empty.

schema.name: split_up
schema.description: To indicate whether this order is split to fullfil order(forder) level. Call GetForderInfo if it's "true".

schema.name: buyer_cancel_reason
schema.description: Cancel reason from buyer, could be empty.

schema.name: cancel_by
schema.description: Could be one of buyer, seller, system or Ops.

schema.name: cancel_reason
schema.description: Use this field to get reason for buyer, seller, and system cancellation.

schema.name: actual_shipping_fee_confirmed
schema.description: Use this filed to judge whether the actual_shipping_fee is confirmed.

schema.name: buyer_cpf_id
schema.description: Buyer's CPF number for taxation and invoice purposes. Only for Brazil order.

schema.name: fulfillment_flag
schema.description: Use this field to indicate the order is fulfilled by shopee or seller. Applicable values: fulfilled_by_shopee, fulfilled_by_cb_seller, fulfilled_by_local_seller.

schema.name: pickup_done_time
schema.description: The timestamp when pickup is done.

schema.name: package_list
schema.description: The list of package under an order

schema.name: package_number
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for the package under an order.

schema.name: logistics_status
schema.description: The Shopee logistics status for the order. Applicable values: See Data Definition-LogisticsStatus.

schema.name: logistics_channel_id
schema.description: The identity of logistic channel.

schema.name: shipping_carrier
schema.description: The logistics service provider that the buyer selected for the order to deliver items.

schema.name: allow_self_design_awb
schema.description: To indicate whether the package allows for self-designed AWB, if allow_self_design_awb returns false, it means that the package does not allow for self-designed AWB and only the system-AWB can be used.

schema.name: item_list
schema.description: The lis of items.

schema.name: item_id
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for an item.

schema.name: model_id
schema.description: Shopee's unique identifier for a model.

schema.name: model_quantity
schema.description: The number of identical items/variations purchased at the same time by the same buyer from one listing/item.

schema.name: order_item_id
schema.description: The identify of order item. For items in one same bundle deal promotion, the order_item_id should share the same id, such as 1,2. For items not in bundle deal promotion, the order_item_id should be the same as item_id.

schema.name: promotion_group_id
schema.description: The identify of product promotion.

schema.name: product_location_id
schema.description: The warehouse ID of the item.

schema.name: parcel_chargeable_weight
schema.description: display weight used to calculate ASF for this parcel

schema.name: group_shipment_id
schema.description: The common identifier for multiple orders combined in the same parcel.

schema.name: virtual_contact_number
schema.description: [Only for TW non-integrated channel] The virtual phone number to contact the recipient.

schema.name: package_query_number
schema.description: [Only for TW non-integrated channel] The query number used in virtual phone number calls to contact the recipient of this package.

schema.name: invoice_data
schema.description: The invoice data of the order.

schema.name: number
schema.description: The number of the invoice.

schema.name: series_number
schema.description: The series number of the invoice.

schema.name: access_key
schema.description: The access key of the invoice.

schema.name: issue_date
schema.description: The issue date of the invoice.

schema.name: total_value
schema.description: The total value of the invoice.

schema.name: products_total_value
schema.description: The products total value of the invoice.

schema.name: tax_code
schema.description: The tax code for the invoice.

schema.name: checkout_shipping_carrier
schema.description: For non masking order, the logistics service provider that the buyer selected for the order to deliver items. For masking order, the logistics service type that the buyer selected for the order to deliver items.

schema.name: reverse_shipping_fee
schema.description: Shopee charges the reverse shipping fee for the returned order.The value of this field will be non-negative.

schema.name: order_chargeable_weight_gram
schema.description: display weight used to calculate ASF for this order

schema.name: prescription_images
schema.description: Return prescription images of this order, only for ID and PH whitelist sellers. Please add the prefix to review: for ID: https://cf.shopee.co.id/file/+prescription_image for PH:https://cf.shopee.ph/file/+prescription_image

schema.name: prescription_check_status
schema.description: enum OrderPrescriptionCheckStatus: NONE = 0; PASSED = 1; FAILED = 2; Only for ID and PH whitelist sellers.

schema.name: edt_from
schema.description: Earliest estimated delivery date of orders (only available for BR region)

schema.name: edt_to
schema.description: Latest estimated delivery time of orders (only available for BR region)

schema.name: booking_sn
schema.description: Return by default. Shopee's unique identifier for a booking. Only returned for advance fulfilment matched order only.

schema.name: advance_package
schema.description: Indicate whether order will be fulfilled using advance fulfilment stock or not. If value is true, order will be matched with a booking and seller should not arrange shipment.

schema.name: return_request_due_date
schema.description: This field represents the deadline for buyers to initiate returns and refunds after order is completed. The ‚Äúreturn_request_due_date‚Äù response parameter will be returned if the requested order meets ALL the conditions below: - The status of the order is COMPLETED - The return refund eligibility of the order is true If you have any questions related to the function of "returns and refunds after order is completed," please refer to the following link: https://seller.shopee.tw/edu/article/18474

schema.name: warning
schema.description: Indicate warning message you should take care.

error_codes.message: Sorry you don't have the permission, detail: {msg}.
System error. Please try again later.
There is no access_token in query.
There is no partner_id in query.
There is no sign in query.
